Column Comment.0: POLYGON ID: Unique identifier to track the polygonal outline of a spatial object.Complex polygons are permitted.
Column Comment.1: ACQUISITION IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for the coordinate acquisition.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BOUNDARY DIRECTION: Direction from starting point to connect boundary points inpolygon. May be clockwise or counter clockwise.
Column Comment.4: CONTAINED BY POLYGON IDENTIFIER: the unique identifier of a polygon thatcontains this one. Usually used in the case where the inner polygon represents anarea of exclusion to the outer polygon. The outer polygon may contain one or moresuch exclusions.
Column Comment.5: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.6: DATUM ELEVATION: The elevation of the vertical datum used to measure theposition of downhole positions such as well points or geophones.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXCLUSION IND: EXCLUSION IND: Indicates whether the polygon is an area ofexclusion (Y= the area is an exclusion)
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: INCLUSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this polygon represents an areaof inclusion. Areas of exclusion can be indicated using the column EXCLUSION IND.
Column Comment.12: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.13: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.14: MAXIMUM PLOT SCALE: The maximum scale that this polygon should be used for.
Column Comment.15: MINIMUM PLOT SCALE: The minimum scale that this polygon should be used for.
Column Comment.16: POLYGON SET IDENTIFIER: Use this column when a spatial description requiresmultiple polygons and more than one set of the polygons may be stored for use (suchas at different scales). Each set is grouped by the SET ID.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: PREFERRED INDICATOR; A Y/N flag indicating that this polygon is part of the setthat should be mapped by preference.
Column Comment.19: REFERENCE DATUM: the datum to which the elevations or depths have beenreferenced, such as Mean Sea Level.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: narrative remark about the polygon
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.23: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
